intro: Paullinia mollicoma, commonly known as the silky sarsapilla, is a species of flowering plant in the Sapindaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Paullinia mollicoma is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
